alert.note: Alert for Blair; Cambria; Clearfield; Elk; Huntingdon; Mifflin; Northern Centre; Southern Centre (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 5:55AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN CENTRE... CLEARFIELD...BLAIR...CAMBRIA...ELK...HUNTINGDON...MIFFLIN...AND SOUTHERN CENTRE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 554 AM EST, a band of heavy snow was over Clearfield moving southeast at 45 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Houtzdale around 605 AM EST. South Philipsburg, Osceola Mills and Chester Hill around 610 AM EST. Black Moshannon State Park around 615 AM EST. Bald Eagle around 620 AM EST. Stormstown, Port Matilda and Warriors Mark around 625 AM EST. Park Forest Village around 630 AM EST. For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the Dubois and Snow Shoe exits, specifically from mile markers 97 to 141. This includes Interstate 99 from mile markers 36 to 79. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Blair; Cambria; Clearfield; Elk; Huntingdon; Mifflin; Northern Centre; Southern Centre
